tata chemic buy call target rs - stop loss rs .

BoB should clearly be a standout performer and we are still quite bullish on SBI, although PNB results were not up to the mark. Going ahead we still feel that most of the PSU banks will perform better. So PNB will surely be one of them. This is what I have been advising now for the last 8 to 10 days, saying that at every rise it is time to book out to a certain extent. It is always prudent. I am talking about 30% to 35% of the portfolio. Especially if you bought in the last five or six months, you are actually sitting on profits ranging from 40% to possibly 100-150% in some cases. So when you are sitting on that sort of profit, it is always prudent to book out to a certain extent because the best of the news is already there in the price. Assuming that the turn out to be true, you can possibly have one more bump — up 150-200 points may be — but that is not really worth playing for. Because in case the final result turns out differently and the exit polls are off the mark, the downside could be huge. So it is better to take that bird which is in your hand than hope for two in the bush, as the saying goes. To a large extent I will book out the OMCs, because I had recommended HPCL way back in October-November at about 170-175 levels, and if one is making 100% plus in a stock like that, it is prudent to book out to a large extent. If you are talking of Reliance, the move has just begun. In fact, I was one of the very few people who were actually bullish on Reliance all through. We had a price target of about 1175-1200. So that should be achieved quite soon. In fact, I had that target in the next 8-10 months. But in the light of recent developments, that should now happen in the next eight weeks.
